message_1: A spaceship moves away from Earth with a speed of 0.8c (where c is the speed of light) and its rest mass is 1000 kg. Calculate the relativistic mass of the spaceship.
message_2:
To calculate the relativistic mass of the spaceship, we can use the following formula:

m_rel = m_rest / sqrt(1 - v^2/c^2)

where m_rel is the relativistic mass, m_rest is the rest mass, v is the velocity of the spaceship, and c is the speed of light.

Given that the spaceship's rest mass (m_rest) is 1000 kg and its velocity (v) is 0.8c, we can plug these values into the formula:

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - (0.8c)^2/c^2)

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - 0.64)

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(0.36)

m_rel = 1000 kg / 0.6

So, the relativistic mass of the spaceship is approximately 1666.67 kg.
